intro: Neogaillonia tinctoria, commonly known as the red spider lily, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking red-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling spiders, hence its common name. The plant has strap-like, dark green leaves and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Neogaillonia tinctoria is also valued for its historical use in traditional medicine and dye production.
